snippet: Jurors found that Chrysler acted with reckless disregard for human life in selling the 1999 Jeep with a rear-mounted gas tank. At least 75 people have died in post-crash fires.
abstract: Jury in Decatur County, Georgia, awards $150 million to family of 4-year-old boy killed in post-crash fire of Jeep Grand Cherokee in 2012; rules Chrysler acted with reckless disregard for human life in selling family 1999 Jeep with gas tank mounted behind rear axle.
lead_paragraph: Jurors found that Chrysler acted with reckless disregard for human life in selling the 1999 Jeep with a rear-mounted gas tank. At least 75 people have died in post-crash fires.

headline.main: Jury Makes Chrysler Pay $150 Million to Family of Boy Killed in Jeep Grand Cherokee
headline.print_headline: Jury Makes Chrysler Pay $150 Million to Family of Boy Killed in Jeep Grand Cherokee
